node.name: RareDAO Top Hat
node.description: The broadest admin authority of the DAO's onchain roles. Held by a 3 of 4 multi-sig composed of the Foundation Director, Foundation Supervisor, Foundation Operator, and RareDAO Council.

node.name: RareDAO Configurator
node.description: Autonomous Admin(s), added by the RareDAO Super Admin role. Used in order to automate certain operations.

node.name: RareDAO Council
node.description: The 4-of-7 multi-sig composed of RareDAO's council members (role 22.1.2), which governs the treasury, protocol upgrades, RareDAO Foundation, and other subsidiary working groups.

node.name: Foundation
node.description: RareDAO Foundation (RDF) holds title to the treasury and provides limited liability for service providers and token holders. It is governed by the DAO Council.

node.name: Foundation Director
node.description: An individual tasked with handling the day-to-day operations and management of the RareDAO Foundation.

authorities.label: Engage service providers
authorities.description: Engage service providers as required to maintain Foundation operations and compliance.

authorities.label: Foundation expense account
authorities.description: Administer the Foundation Operating Expense Account.

node.name: Foundation Operator
node.description: An individual tasked with managing day-to-day operations of the Foundation, cultivating efficiency, regulatory compliance, and strategic alignment across service providers, working groups, and the council.

node.name: Foundation Accountant
node.description: An individual tasked with managing day-to-day operations of the Foundation, cultivating efficiency, regulatory compliance, and strategic alignment across service providers, working groups, and the council.

node.name: Foundation Supervisor
node.description: An independent supervisor of the RareDAO Foundation responsible for ensuring compliance with the articles of incorporation and by-laws.

node.name: Foundation Operating Expense Account
node.description: A multi-sig established by the Council which gives the Foundation Director and select foundation contributors control of limited funds for de minimus transactions and operating expenses.

node.name: Network Engagement Fund
node.description: A 2 of 3 multi-sig composed of the Foundation Director, Foundation Operator, and Foundation Accountant controlling the network engagement fund, a pool of RARE earmarked for community incentives.

node.name: Grants Team
node.description: Incentivizes open source development of core protocol infrastructure and public goods which create positive network effects around the DAO.

node.name: Grants Committee
node.description:
A Safe multi-sig, powered by the Hats Signer Gate module, configured with the following parameters:
- Signers Hat - the Grants Committee Member hat (role 22.1.1.2.2)
- Owner Hat - the RareDAO Council hat.
- Min threshold - 3.
- Target threshold - 4.
- Max signers - 25.

node.name: Grants Committee Chair
node.description: An individual appointed by the grants committee who is charged with maintaining the application pipeline, organizing meetings, and facilitating the administrative work associated with individual grants such as drafting of the grant agreement and definition of milestones.

node.name: Grants Committee Member
node.description: Signers on the grants committe multi-sig (role 22.1.1.2.1).

node.name: DAO Ops Team
node.description: Incentivizes open source development of core protocol infrastructure and public goods which create positive network effects around the DAO.

node.name: Lead DAO Ops Steward
node.description: An administrative role held by a single person charged with being the accountable party for and neutral facilitator of all DAO Operations. This individual should serve as a conduit between the Council, the RareDAO Foundation, SuperRare Labs, and the community.

authorities.label: Administer Council elections
authorities.description: Administer council elections at the end of each council term and assist with the new council member onboarding process.

authorities.label: DAO Ops stewards
authorities.description: Appoint DAO Ops Stewards to assist with various facets of the DAO Ops Stewardship team’s mandate.

node.name: DAO Ops Steward
node.description: An individual working full-time to manage day-to-day operations of the RareDAO Foundation while supporting the DAO Council and other working groups. Charged with upholding standards of efficiency, accountability, innovation, and regulatory compliance across the organization.

authorities.label: Read and write access to all council documentation

node.name: SuperRare Labs Representative
node.description: A SuperRare Labs (SRL) employee appointed by the Lead DAO Ops Steward to represent SRL in council meetings.

authorities.label: Attend council meetings
authorities.description: The SRL Rep may attend council meetings. If they are unable to attend, should share any relevant information with the Lead DAO Ops Steward or a council member so they may present SRL updates on their behalf.

authorities.label: Access council documentation
authorities.description: The SRL Rep may contribute agenda items to the weekly meetings, at the Lead DAO Ops Steward's discretion, but may not submit or vote on council proposals.

node.name: RareDAO Council Member
node.description: Elected members of the RareDAO Council, signers on its multi-sig (role 22.1.1).

authorities.label: Administer the SIP process
authorities.description:
- Sponsoring SIP on the forum and posting them to snapshot.
- Execute approved proposals via the DAO multi-sig.

authorities.label: Limited authority over the DAO multi-sig
authorities.description:
Exercise limited authority over the DAO Foundation multi-sig.
- Emergency protocol updates.
- Executing de minimus transactions and any transactions that have been pre-authorized (“earmarked”) via the SIP process.
- Changes to DAO’s composition or structure via the RareDAO Hats tree.
- Updates to the bylaws and the delegation of council authority.

authorities.label: Manage stewardship teams and DAO contributors
authorities.description:
- Controlling access to funding via the DAO treasury.
- Controlling stewardship team composition and their delegated authorities.
